outputs.output_descr:
The Country Programme Action Plan for St. Lucia identified the following key elements under the Thematic area of Governance.
"Fostering democratic governance tools: multi-stakeholder dialogue,sport and cultural development, public information targeting youth, women and communities established and local representative democracy enhanced with increased participation of women."

Outputs: Capacity building and leadership development for Civil Society Organizations to participate effectively in national policy debates and dialogue strengthened.
Awareness of Civil Society Organizations and the general public on development imperatives and issues strengthened.
Publication of information material including children friendly material on development issues, governance, poverty reduction, regional intergration, environment and
Public education strategy to support the constitutional reform process designed and implemented.

"Public Sector Modernisation and Organization of Eastern Carribbean States (OECS) Economic Union strengthened by Human Resources Development, Information and Communications Technology inputs, public/private dialogues, as well as enhanced support to transparency and accountability programmes."
Outputs:
 (a) Strengthened capacity of the management of the Public Sector Investment Programme process;
(b) Common criteria and framework to assess project eligibility for Public Sector Investment Programme established, taking into account inter-sectoral impact.
(c) Establishment of a Performance Management System for Public Service.
At the regional level, UNDP will support the following three outputs in cooperation with the regional multi-donor funded initiatives- Caribbean Centre for Development Administration and Caribbean Regional Technical Assistance Centre:
(d) Improved macro-economic, fiscal, public finance and debt management;
(e) Improved financial sector regulation and supervision, revenue policy formulation and effective revenue administration, including issues related to the introduction of Value Added Tax, reform of the tax consumption system and the modernisation of the customs operations; and
(f) Improved capacities to collect, process, analyse and publish economic statistics and countries' capacity to undertake macroeconomic projections and policy analysis.
